definition: to earn a living (esp. with negative)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by

sentences.english: The people here are reduced to dire poverty because of (the) natural disasters.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人们由于自然灾害而穷不聊生。

sentences.english: Ming Wanghou, China is in the dark ages, the nobody expressing an opinion, the people have no means to make a living.
sentences.chinese: 明亡后，中国处于黑暗时代，万马齐喑，民不聊生。

definition: (of a country) to perish/to be annexed/subjugation (to a foreign power)
lacking in cohesion and unity of purpose
famine repeats unceasingly (idiom, from Book of Songs)
the common people in a miserable state
not to worry/not to show concern
succeed or fail, sharp or blunt (idiom); advantages and disadvantages/success and failure/You win some, you lose some.
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
